Donor Agency: Federal Ministry of Health
Channel of Delivery Name: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: BERNHARD NOCHT INSTITUTE FOR TROPICAL MEDICINE (BNITM)
Project title: Bernhard Nocht Institute for Tropical Medicine (BNITM)
Long Description: Research, teaching, training and further education as well as consulting and health care in the fields of infectious and tropical medicine. The BNITM is Germany's largest institution for research, treatment and training in the field of tropical diseases and new emerging infections. As a member of the Leibniz-Association and as a research institute of national importance, the Institute is jointly funded by the Federal Government, the Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg and the other federal states. Research topics include clinical studies, epidemiology and disease control as well as the biology of pathogens, their reservoirs and vectors. The current scientific focus is on malaria, haemorrhagic fever viruses, immunology, epidemiology and clinical studies of tropical infections as well as on the mechanisms of the viral transmission by mosquitoes. For the handling of highly pathogenic viruses and infected insects, the Institute has laboratories of the highest biosafety level (BSL-4) and a BSL-3 insectary. The Institute's health care services include specific laboratory diagnostics of tropical diseases and other rare infections, close cooperation with the German Federal Defence Forces concerning medical care for military deployments in the tropics as well as the consultation of the scientific community, politics and the general public, which essentially contribute to the Institute's national reputation. The Institute has been appointed by the Federal Ministry of Health as the National Reference Center (NRC) for the detection of all tropical pathogens as well as by the WHO (= World Health Organisation) as Collaborating Center for arboviruses and haemorrhagic fever viruses. In collaboration with the Ghanaian Health Ministry and the University of Kumasi the Institute has been operating a modern research and training center in the West-African rain forest for over ten years, which is also available to external research groups. The teaching activities comprise a three months full-time course on all aspects of tropical medicine for physicians as well as a training program for PhD students at the Institute and a number of activities on continuing education in topics related to travel medicine and international health. Numerous scientists of the Institute are involved in student teaching as appointed professors of the University and the University Hospital of Hamburg.

Long Description: Cornerstones of the project work of the regional project for Southeast and East Europe (only in developing countries) of the Foundation for Freedom are the human and civil rights in a functioning constitutional state, the acceptance of pluralistic structures and the protection of the right to property and the promotion of private sector activities in the framework of a market economy. Project title: Africa I, Development of Self-help-Organisations - Fighting poverty through social structures training by the association
Long Description: This project enables economically and socially disadvantaged people in Eastern and Southern Africa to improve their incomes. They are supported through boosting agricultural production and promotion of processing and marketing of products and through the support of microfinance. In South Africa vocational training opportunities are organized for unemployed young adults.

Long Description: The project aims to strengthen co-operative structures in the financial, agricultural and service sectors. In order to make the political dialogue on migration within and from Africa more objective, a Friedrich-Ebert-Foundation-Centre of Competence shall be established.

Long Description: The programme of socio-political measures for more democratic participation, social justice and a sustainable and peaceful development comprises activities in Southern Africa and Germany. It aims to enable people to gain sovereignty and to enable them to actively participate within the democratic processes and peacefully articulate their interests/concerns

Long Description: With its Socio-Political Advisory Programme in Sub-Saharan Africa Friedrich-Ebert-Foundation carries out political education and offers policy advice. Friedrich-Ebert-Foundation implements a variety of activities in the assigned areas of promoting democracy, media policy and media development, peace and security, cooperation with trade unions as well as sustainable economies.

Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: REGIONAL PROGRAMME SUB-SAHARAN AFRIKA
Project title: Regional Programme Sub-Saharan Afrika
Long Description: The programme focuses on the strengthening of parliaments and political parties, the strengthening of democratic structures and processes, civil society and the rule of law. It fosters dialogue on national, regional and global concepts for development as well as the promotion of regional integration. Security policy dialogue, input into security policies are also key areas of engagement as it is responsible media work in cooperation with state actors and non- governmental partners.

Long Description: The programme links actors from the fields of agricultural and trade politics in order to contribute to a socio-ecological transformation of the global agriculture and to strengthen local food sovereignty in the programme countries

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: DECENTRALISATION, DEMOCRATISATION, GOOD GOVERNANCE, CONFLICT PREVENTION AND THE PROMOTION OF ECONOMIC POLICY IN WEST AND CENTRAL AFRICA
Project title: Decentralisation, Democratisation, Good Governance, Conflict Prevention And The Promotion of Economic Policy in West and Central Africa
Long Description: The country specific projects contribute to fostering good governance with a particular focus on strengthening a vibrant civil society, rule of law, decentralised administration and conflict preventive sensitisation. Furthermore, regional approaches shall be expanded, in order to strengthen south-south-cooperation and the interoperability of best practices. This integrative approach emphasises citizen friendly policing, socio-political commitment, improvement of public services and the strength of local economies.

Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: IMPROVEMENT OF ACCESS TO FINANCIAL SERVICES IN SUB-SAHARA AFRICA THROUGH POST OFFICE SAVINGS BANKS
Project title: Improvement of access to financial services in Sub-Sahara Africa through Post Office Savings Banks
Long Description: The main goal of the project is to contribute to improved access to financial services outside the economic centers of the project participating countries. The project goal in pilot land Zambia in the orientation phase is to effectively use the branch network of NATSAVE to improve access to financial services for the general public and of micro-enterprises. During the orientation phase, the project will be extended to a second country in the region.

Long Description: Financing for consultancy services of one partner, of groups of partners or of partners outside of a regular project or for partners without access to the established consulting network in Subsahara Africa. It offers a more flexible way of financing consultancy and workshop related costs for partner qualification and dialogue formats which often cannot be part of project planning due to short-term demands.

Long Description: The programme promotes the political, economic and social development of the Middle East and North Africa and facilitates dialogue and cooperation between Germany/Europe and the states as well as among the societies of the region. Emphasis is put on democracy and rule of law, free and pluralistic civil society, social and ecological market economy, including entrepreneurship, as well as on the joint responsibility to work against the roots and repercussions of terrorism and forced migration.

Long Description: Cornerstones of the project work of the regional project forSoutheast and East Europe of the Foundation for Freedomare the human and civil rights in a functioning constitutional state, the acceptance of pluralistic structures and the protection of the right to property and the promotion of private sector activities in the framework of a market economy. The objective is to move towards open civil societies, which - as formulated by the Development Policy Report of the Federal Government - give people the possibility to live a life of freedom, peace and selfreliance'.

Long Description: The regional programme 'Middle East and North Africa aims to empower politicians, decision makers, activists and NGOs in the region, to effectively work on the topics environmental justice, democratisation, gender democracy and conflict management as well as culture and dialogue intheir respective context (here - Egypt, Iraq, Iran, Jordan, Lebanon, Morocco, Palestine, Syria, Tunisia).

Project title: Democracy and Peace
Long Description: This programme aims at substantiating and further qualifying the programmatic work in the areas 'democracy building and political participation, 'gender politics and LGBTI and 'digital change. It contributes to enable colleagues, partners and activists to work effectively towards democracy, political participation, gender democracy, internet freedom, digital human rights. Furthermore, the programme will provide new impulses in the political and expert debates.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: INTERREGIONAL PROJECT TO PROMOTE DIALOGUE ON ECONOMICS, MIGRATION, HUMAN RIGHTS, THE RULE OF LAW AND SECURITY
Project title: Interregional Project to promote dialogue on economics, migration, human rights, the rule of law and security
Long Description: The project aims to promote liberal and cross-regional cooperation in the area of migration and the elimination of flight causes, thereby adding value both to the political debate in Germany and to the content-related development of existing and new partnerships to combat poverty and flight causes in countries of origin and transit. Its objectives are to connect stakeholders and to develop liberal options for action for countries affected by crises before introducing them to the German or European discourse.

Long Description: Preparatory measures are an essential instrument for the development of possible perspectives and spheres of activities for a future Heinrich-B÷ll-Foundation's engagement in a new region or for a new thematic focus. Expert discussions, workshops or meetings with potential partner organisations and representatives of important public authorities in the region as well as studies and consulting are also part of the programme. In addition, detailed questions can be clarified that arise when setting up a new presence on site or when develop new challenges for foreign offices.

Long Description: Strengthening of the banking sector in Mongolia through professionalisation of the bank-specific training and its introduction to international standards. The project objective is the conceptual and contentual development of the dual training course to the bank specialist with a total duration of eight months divided into about 40% theory and 60% practice in the respective departments of the participating banks. Another goal is the introduction of the World Day in Mongolia.

The goal is to promote dialogue and networks in the context of the United Nations among central actors of the global south as well as between actors of the global south and north in the field of development politics. The main topics are 'global social rights' and 'socio-ecological transformation'. Instruments are events, publications and other educational material amongst others.

Every year, it uses the exchange of research institutes within the framework of a conference lasting several days to analyse problem areas of national and international order as well as global developments, to determine positions and to identify opportunities for cooperation, especially in the development of global governance structures.

Short Description: PROMOTION OF PROCESSES OF REFORM IN THE FIELD OF SOCIOPOLITICAL, EDUCATIONAL AND ECONOMIC TRANSFORMATION IN THE P.R. OF CHINA
Project title: Promotion of Processes of Reform in the Field of Sociopolitical, Educational and Economic Transformation in the P.R. of China
Long Description: The project will contribute to the implementation of selected United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals in China, such as ensuring inclusive, equitable and quality education, reducing inequality within and among countries, promoting sustainable rural development as well as environmental and climate protection, promoting peaceful and inclusive societies and strengthening partnerships for sustainable development.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: PROMOTION OF THE RULE OF LAW AND MARKET ECONOMY IN CHINA - GLOBAL INNOVATION
Project title: Promotion of the rule of law and market economy in China - Global Innovation
Long Description: Despite increasingly difficult framework conditions, the project helps to develop liberal concepts in the areas of the rule of law and the market economy in China and to introduce them into the public discourse. The Global Innovation Hub will better empower the global FNF partners to promote human rights, democracy and the rule of law through digital innovation, including through exchanges with the countries of the Global South on digitisation and innovation.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
Type of Aid Name: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Short Description: PROMOTION OF THE RULE OF LAW AND MARKET ECONOMY IN THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA
Project title: Promotion of the rule of law and market economy in the People's Republic of China
Long Description: The project helps to develop liberal concepts in the areas of rule of law, market economy and administrative reforms. These concepts are made part of relevant debates. Moreover the project consolidates and improves the transnational exchange. All of this is done despite and to counter balance an increasingly difficult environment.These objectives are achieved by civic education, political consultancies and dialogue programmes.

Long Description: Development in the wake of the chinese globalisation - Strengthening of regional civil societies, networks and environmental and social standards

Project title: Promotion of Processes in the field of Socio-political, Educational and Economic Transformation in the P.R. of China
Long Description: The promotion of decent living conditions for individuals and a sustainable social development are key objectives of the international commitments of the Hanns Seidel Foundation. In both areas, which are closely related to each other, there is a need for action in the PRC. In the focus of the Foundation's activities in the PRC stand the reduction of social inequality in order to improve not only the living conditions of disadvantaged groups, but also contribute to a more peaceful, balanced and long-term positive development of the country.

Donor Agency: Bundesministerium fnr Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

Project title: Approaches to a socio-ecological transformation in East Asia and dialogues for a peaceful and just world
Long Description: Between 2018 and 2020. the programme provides the basis for exchanges of and with scholars. polit ical advisors and decision makers on development models and practices aimed at strengthening approaches to socio-ecological transformations in China. Mongolia and in DPRK and promoting dialogues for a peaceful and just world.

Short Description: REGIONAL PROGRAMME ASIA

Long Description: The Konrad-Adenauer-Foundation's Regional Programme Asia fosters democracy and rule of law, regional integration, peaceful resolution of conflicts and sustainable solutions (in social as well as in climate policy terms) for economic development. As a result she contributes to prosperity, security and stability in Asia. It seeks to promote an early detection of international crises and to assist policy makers with developing tools to counter these crises.

Long Description: The programme promotes participative decision making processes, a just distribution of wealth and resources and a healthy environment. It, thus, contributes to creating and protecting social, economic, ecological and political rights for all as well as overcoming uneven power relations in the programme countries of Vietnam, Cambodia Laos, and Myanmar

Project title: Support of democracy, rule of law, Pluralism and market economy in South East and East Asia
Long Description: This project helps to strenthen and develop liberal institutions, participative and pluralistic democracies, rule of law with effctive mechanisms for the protection of human rights and market economy in Southeast and East Asia. This is achieved by civic education, political consultancies and dialogue programmes. These activities are aimed at people in leadership positions, young leaders and orofessionals, who serve as multipliers in society for achieving sustainable and broad implementation of liberal solutions to economic, political and social issues.
